comment:
QA Pre-Review of CR-076 v0.1 -- REQUEST UPDATES

FRONTMATTER:
- title: 'Harden MCP Identity Management' -- verified present and non-empty.
- revision_summary: 'Initial draft' -- acceptable for v0.1.

STRUCTURE: All 12 SOP-002 required sections (Purpose, Scope, Current State, Proposed State, Change Description, Justification, Impact Assessment, Testing Summary, Implementation Plan, Execution, Execution Summary, References) are present and correctly numbered 1-12.

PLACEHOLDER CONTENT: No {{}} placeholders, TBD, TODO, FIXME, or XXX found in pre-approved sections (1-9). Execution-phase placeholders in sections 10-11 are acceptable at pre-review stage.

TRACEABILITY: Parent document INV-011 verified -- exists at v1.2 IN_EXECUTION status. References to SOP-001, SOP-002, SOP-006, REQ-MCP-015, REQ-MCP-016 are appropriate.

FORMATTING: Consistent use of ## section headers, ### sub-headers, horizontal rules, tables, and code formatting throughout.

DEFICIENCY FOUND -- INTERNAL INCONSISTENCY IN TEST RENAME COUNT:
- Section 2.3 (Files Affected): states 'rename 4'
- Section 5.4 (Test Suite detail): states 'Rename 3 tests' and lists only 3 renames
- Section 8 (Testing Summary): states '4 tests renamed'
Two sections say 4 renames, one section says 3 renames and only lists 3 items. Either Section 5.4 is missing a fourth rename, or Sections 2.3 and 8 have incorrect counts. This internal contradiction must be resolved.

REVIEWER ASSIGNMENT: No TU reviewers assigned. The available TUs (tu_ui, tu_scene, tu_sketch, tu_sim) correspond to Flow State application domains. This CR affects only MCP server infrastructure and QMS tooling, which falls outside all TU domain expertise. QA will serve as sole reviewer.

DISPOSITION: Request updates to resolve the rename count inconsistency before proceeding.

QA Pre-Review of CR-076 v0.1 (Round 2) -- RECOMMEND

PRIOR DEFICIENCY RESOLVED:
The rename count inconsistency has been corrected. All five locations where the rename count appears (Sections 2.3, 5.4, 7.1, 8, and 9.4) now consistently state 'rename 3'. The distinction between 3 pure renames (behavior unchanged) and 1 rewrite (renamed and behavior changed) is clear and correctly counted separately throughout.

FULL RE-VERIFICATION:

Frontmatter:
- title: 'Harden MCP Identity Management' -- present, non-empty.
- revision_summary: 'Initial draft' -- acceptable for v0.1.

Structure: All 12 SOP-002 required sections present (Purpose, Scope, Current State, Proposed State, Change Description, Justification, Impact Assessment, Testing Summary, Implementation Plan, Execution, Execution Summary, References), numbered 1-12.

Placeholder content: No prohibited placeholders (TBD, TODO, FIXME, XXX, {{}}) in pre-approved sections 1-9. Execution-phase placeholders in sections 10-11 are appropriate at pre-review stage.

Traceability: Parent document INV-011 verified at v1.2 IN_EXECUTION. References to SOP-001, SOP-002, SOP-006, REQ-MCP-015, REQ-MCP-016 are appropriate.

Internal consistency: All counts (delete 1, rename 3, add 5, rewrite 1, total 397/75) are consistent across Sections 2.3, 5.4, 7.1, 8, and 9.4. Net test arithmetic verified: 393-1+5=397, 71-1+5=75.

Formatting: Consistent headers, tables, horizontal rules, and code formatting throughout. No typos or errors found.

Scope: Complete per SOP-002 Section 6.2 (Context with INV-011 parent, Changes Summary with 8 items, Files Affected with 5 files).

Impact assessment: Thorough -- covers files, documents, breaking changes, development controls, and qualified state continuity.

TU assignment: No TU reviewers required. This CR affects MCP server infrastructure and QMS tooling only, outside all available TU domain expertise.

DISPOSITION: Recommend for pre-approval.

QA Post-Review of CR-076 v1.1 -- RECOMMEND

PRE-APPROVED CONTENT INTEGRITY:
Diff between archived v1.0 and draft v1.1 confirms zero changes in Sections 1-9. All modifications are confined to Section 10 (EI table), Execution Comments, and Section 11 (Execution Summary). VERIFIED.

EXECUTION ITEM TABLE (Section 10):
All 6 EI rows verified:
- EI-1: Pass. Branch cr-076-harden-identity created from main (94345fa). Baseline 393 tests confirmed.
- EI-2: Pass. SDLC-QMS-RS v12.0 EFFECTIVE -- independently verified via qms status.
- EI-3: Pass. Implementation per plan. Commit a0b1c19 documented.
- EI-4: Pass. 396 tests pass, CI run 21891224329. Variance from planned 397 documented.
- EI-5: Pass. SDLC-QMS-RTM v14.0 EFFECTIVE -- independently verified via qms status.
- EI-6: Pass. PR #12 merged (fbe6e22). Submodule updated.
No remaining [SUMMARY], [Pass/Fail], [PERFORMER], [DATE] placeholders. VERIFIED.

TEST COUNT VARIANCE:
Plan predicted 397 tests (75 in test_mcp.py). Actual is 396 (74 in test_mcp.py). Root cause documented in both EI-4 summary and Execution Comments: the rewritten test was double-counted as both rewrite and add in the plan. Actual net change: -1 + 4 = +3, yielding 396. No material impact -- all hardened behaviors are tested. Adequately documented without requiring a VAR.

EXECUTION SUMMARY (Section 11):
Complete narrative covering: all 6 EIs successful, key implementation changes listed, test count and CI verification cited, RS v12.0 and RTM v14.0 EFFECTIVE confirmed, PR merge and submodule update referenced, 397-vs-396 variance with root cause explained. VERIFIED.

SOP-002 SECTION 7.3 POST-REVIEW CONDITIONS:
(1) All EIs Pass -- VERIFIED.
(2) No blocking VARs -- N/A (no VARs created).
(3) Modified controlled docs EFFECTIVE -- RS v12.0 and RTM v14.0 both EFFECTIVE, independently verified.
(4) Evidence documented in EI summaries -- VERIFIED.
(5) SDLC prerequisites (RS/RTM EFFECTIVE per SOP-006 Section 7.4) -- VERIFIED.

PLACEHOLDER CHECK:
No [SUMMARY], [Pass/Fail], [PERFORMER], [DATE], [COMMENT], or [EXECUTION_SUMMARY] placeholders remain. VERIFIED.

DISPOSITION: Recommend for post-approval.
